attributes.action: Change how much monies you receive from jobseekers and base it on percentage of tax contributions
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Why should you get £60 a week jobseekers allowance, how are we as a public meant to survive on that poor ammount, when a few weeks prior we was earning around for example £500 a week and contributing £110 a week into the tax into the system.
Why is the job seeker allowance not paid back through to the person claiming, as a percentage of your tax payments that have been paid into the system.
Whilst taking into account that the people that are earning the higher wage tend to be qualified in a sector, so they would be looking to get back into the industry they were previously working in, which then means the tax contributions when returnng back to work would still be as high as the previous job before loosing it.
